alert.note: Alert for Ouachita (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 01 at 12:02AM CDT until April 01 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN OUACHITA PARISH... At 1202 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Start to near Richwood to 8 miles northwest of Buckner to 12 miles south of Brownsville-Bawcomville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Fondale and Bosco. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for north central Louisiana. A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure, such as a basement or small interior room.
